Instruction: Fry eggplant slices in hot oil until browned thoroughly, about 3 to 5 minutes per side. Add more oil between batches as needed. Drain fried eggplant slices on paper towels and season with salt.
Saute ground beef in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned. Add chopped onions and minced garlic; continue cooking until onions are caramelized.
Simmer the ground beef mixture with spaghetti sauce and oregano until heated through, about 5 to 7 minutes.

Layer half of the eggplant slices in the bottom of a shallow casserole dish, covering it entirely. Pour half of the beef sauce on top of the eggplant. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese over the sauce. Repeat the layers.
Spread olive oil in a pot. Position the pot on the stove over medium-high heat.
Bake until the edges bubble and the center is heated through, about 20 to 25 minutes.
